data.title: Obituaries
data.text:
Francisco Salina Rosas

Age 73, of Blissfield, went to be with the Lord, March 27, 2005, at The Toledo Hospital. He was born February 29, 1932, in Crystal City, TX, the son of Pedro & Jaunita (Salina) Rosas. He was retired from the City of Adrian.

Francisco was preceded in death by his parents, his wife Pauline, a daughter, Gloria Rosas and a son, John Francisco Rosas.

He is survived by his daughters; Margarita Tames of Adrian and Arlene (Ygnacio) Ramonez of Jasper, Olivia Rosas of Dallas, TX, Diana (Rafa) Tello of Dallas, TX, and Gloria Rosas of Arlington, TX, his sons; Ramiro (Elizabeth) Rosas of Adrian and Jose Antonio (Dora) Rosas of Oklahoma, one sister; Mary Diliard of Dallas, TX, five brothers; Richard (Josey) Rosas of Dallas, TX, Albert (Cindy) Rosas of Toledo, OH, Lupe (Lupe) Rosas of Blissfield, MI, Javier (Carolina) Rosas of Dallas, TX, and Mr. & Mrs. Victor Rosas of Tyler, TX, 33 grandchildren and 68 great- grandchildren.

Funeral Services will be held 2:00 PM Thursday in the Christ Temple Church, Adrian, with Albert Rosas officiating. Interment will follow in Riga Cemetery. Visitation will be from 2 to 8 PM on Wednesday in the Purse Funeral Home, Adrian. Memorial Contributions can be made to FranciscoÂ’s family. Messages of sympathy and condolences may be offered to the family at: www.pursefuneralhome.com

Vivian L. Hill

Age 77, of Adrian, passed away, June 14, 2006, at home. She was born August 1, 1928, the daughter of Robert & Gertrude (Nixon) Johnson, in Britton, MI. On August 1, 1952, she married Walter S. Hill, he survives.

In addition to her husband of 53 years, Walter Hill , she is survived by one son; Walter (Robin) Hill, Jr., four daughters; Sandy (Richard) Miller, Susan (Lynn) Brooks, Debi Hill, and Melodie (John) Bradley, eleven grandchildren, eight great grandchildren, and two sisters; Polly Sancho and Frances Ransom.

She was preceded in death by her parents, one son, Tom Kehoe, her daughter in law, Sue Kehoe, three sisters; Armenia Prentiss, Eva Bowman and Marcella Kirkendall Petty, two brothers; Richard Johnson & Charles "Chuck" Johnson, and one grandson; John D. Bradley.

Funeral Services will be held 1:00 PM Saturday, June 17, 2006, in the Purse Funeral Home, Adrian. Interment will follow in Lenawee Hills Memorial Gardens, Tecumseh. Visitation will be on Saturday from 10:00 AM until the time of service in the Purse Funeral Home, Adrian. In lieu of flowers, memorial contributions may be made to the family. Condolences may be offered to the family at: www.pursefuneralhome.com

William P. Snook, Jr.

Age 80, of Tecumseh and the Villages of Lady Lake, FL, died May 27, 2006 at St. Joseph Mercy Hospital, Ann Arbor, surrounded by his family. He was born August 13, 1925 in Lima, OH, the son of W. Perry and Lula A. (Kilgore) Snook. On November 10, 1945, he married Marietta Lou Nichols in Lima, OH. She survives.

Bill was a veteran of the United States Navy, serving during World War II as a member of the SeaBee's. Bill was a graduate of Bowling Green State University, Class of 1950. He was retired from the Tecumseh Products Company with 34 years of service, where he was the Corporate Director of Budget. Bill also was a member of the First Presbyterian Church of Tecumseh, a 50 year member of the Tecumseh Masonic Lodge F&AM #69. He was an avid golfer and Bridge card player. He and his wife Nickie were 25 year members of the Tecumseh Country Club.

In addition to his wife Marietta "Nickie" , Bill is survived by 2 daughters, Josilyn (Reed) Snook Garner of Onsted, Judith (Richard) Graf of Tecumseh; one son, William P. (Debra) Snook, III of Brooklyn; 5 grandchildren, Gretchen Meier of Los Angeles, CA, Jason Meier of Adrian, Megan Graf of Tecumseh, Morgan and Collin Snook of Brooklyn; 3 great grandchildren, Aaron, Emily, and Caleb Meier, and sister Marilyn Wright of Elida, OH.

He was preceded in death by his parents, and his step-father Donald F. Miller.

Funeral services will be held 11:00 a.m. Thursday, June 1, 2006, at the First Presbyterian Church,

Tecumseh, with Rev. Richard Mortimer officiating. Military honors will be also be conducted at the

church by the Tecumseh American Legion #34 and the Tecumseh V.F.W #4187. Interment will take place at Brookside Cemetery at a later date. Visitation will be from 6-8 p.m.Wednesday at Purse

Funeral Home, Tecumseh and from 10:00 a.m until time of services Thursday at the church.

A Masonic service will be conducted 7:00 p.m. by the Tecumseh Masonic Lodge F&AM #69

Memorial contributions may be made to the Building Fund of the First Presbyterian Church, Tecumseh. Condolences may made to the family at: www.pursefuneralhome.com

Gerald Jerome Wilber

Age 70, of Dewey Lake, died May 29, 2006 at home after a brief battle with cancer surrounded by his family.

Mr. Wilber was born January 18, 1936, in Detroit the son of Earl and Thelma ( Tillitson) Wilber. On Jan 6, 1962, he married Linda F. Mooney in

Lincoln Park. She survives.

Mr. Wilber was a resident of the Irish Hills area since 1993 coming from Canton, MI. Gerald was a Tool & Die Maker at Ford Motor Company.

He was a veteran of the U.S. Army serving in Korea.

Gary was always a source of quiet strength in time of crisis. He will long be missed by those who knew and loved him.

In addition to his wife Linda; Gary is survived by 2 daughters, Christine (John) Fredriksen of Canton, and Sharon (Gary) Catenacci of Onsted; son, Vincent (Sue) Wilber of Livonia; sister, Judith (Jim) Burgess of Waterford; brother Earl David (Judith) Wilber of Canton; a special "daughter", Cheryl Kelly of Livonia, and 7 grandchildren.

He was preceded in death by his parents and a brother, Martin.

Funeral services will be held 1:00 p.m. Sunday June 4, 2006 at Springville United Methodist Church with

Pastor Melany Chalker officiating. Interment of cremains will follow in the Memorial Garden at

Springville United Methodist Church. Full military honors will be conducted by Onsted American Legion

Post #550. A luncheon will follow at the Onsted American Legion Post #550.

Memorial Contributions may be made to Onsted American Legion Post #550, 333 Conner Street, Onsted, MI, 49286 Arrangements by Purse Funeral Home, Tecumseh. Condolences may be offered online at: www.pursefuneralhome.com

Bernice "Bunnie" Sylvia Kujat

Age 79 of Tecumseh, died May 30, 2006 at home under the loving care of her family and Great Lakes Hospice.

Bonnie was born July 24, 1926 in Mount Clemens, Michigan to David and Sylvia Francis. On June 8, 1946, Bonnie married Robert F. Kujat. They would have celebrated their 60th wedding anniversary in June of this year. Bunnie was a loving wife, mother, and grandmother whose greatest joy was her family. Bunnie fondly remembered happy times cruising Lake St. Clair with her son and daughter-in-law , Keith and Pam and their children

Living in Tecumseh for the past six years, Bunnie was able to enjoy being close to daughter Mickie's growing family. She delighted in being part of holiday gatherings, graduations, weddings, birthday parties, camping and family picnics. Bunnie was especially partial to son-in-law Doug's barbequed ribs and was known to request a rib dinner just to make an ordinary day a special one. A wonderful woman who ended every phone call with a family member by saying "I Love You." Bunnie will be missed by all who knew and loved her.

Bunnie is survived by her loving husband, Robert; her daughter and son-in-law, Mickie and Doug Miller, and her daughter-in-law Pam Kujat. In addition, Bunnie is survived by six grandchildren; Robert (Marcy) Miller, John (Abby) Miller, Krista Miller (David Rochowiak),

Heather and Brian Brandvold, Krett Kujat, and Kerri Platz (Charlie Cole). Bonnie was also the proud grandmother of seven great grandchildren; Bailey and Brooke Miller, Lexia and Casey Champanois, Jadyn Rochowiak, Wyatt and Mackenzie Brandvold. Her eighth great grandchild is due in October.

Bonnie was preceded in death by her parents, David and Sylvia Francis; a sister, Marie Jeffry; twin brothers, David and Severn Francis, and her son, Keith Kujat.

Funeral services will be held 11:00 a.m. Saturday June 3, 2006 at Purse Funeral Home, Tecumseh, with Erin James officiating. Cremation will follow. Interment of cremains will take place at the Brookside Cemetery Columbarium.

Visitation will be from 2-4 & 6-8 p.m. on Friday at Purse Funeral Home, Tecumseh.

Memorial contributions may be made to Great Lakes Hospice. Condolences may be offered online at: www.pursefuneralhome.com

Marilyn J. Betz

Age 76, of Tecumseh, died April 1, 2006 peacefully at home. Marilyn was born December 1, 1929 in Tecumseh the daughter of Virgil and Sarah (Stutzman) Lowery. Marilyn graduated from Adrian High School and was was a member of the first graduating class of Adrian Beauty Academy. Marilyn was

a member of the Tecumseh VFW Auxiliary and bowled for many years in their league. She also was a member of the Holloway Presbyterian Church.

Marilyn is survived by two sons Gary (Susan) Betz of Lambertville and Terry (Linda) Betz of Tecumseh; one daughter Vicki Betz of Tecumseh; five grandchildren; five great grandchildren; and numerous nieces and nephews. Besides her parents, Marilyn was preceded in death by three brothers Virgil, Jr., Donald, and Darrell Lowery. At her request, cremation has taken place. Funeral arrangements were entrusted to the Purse Funeral Home, Tecumseh. Condolences may be made to

the family at www.pursefuneralhome.com.

Robert D. Powell

Age 78, of Hudson, passed away May 23, 2006, at Veterans Administration Hospital in Ann Arbor. He was born March 29, 1928, in Athens, OH, the son of Arthur & Eleanor (Atkinson) Powell. On may 14,

1946, he married Hope Hull, she survives. Together they had five children. Robert served in the U.S. Navy during WWII as a Sea Bee and worked in the construction industry all his life. Robert was a lifetime member of the National Rifle Association and three time 1000 yard national match champion. He was also an avid outdoorsman, hunter, and horseman.

Besides his wife Hope, Bob is survived by two daughters; Roberta (James) Henning and Mary (Phil) Seeburger both of Adrian, two sons; Kim Powell of Lansing and Alan Powell of Hudson, one daughter in law; Deborah (Jay) Powell of Canton, three sisters; Jean Dittmar, Lois Evans, and Mary Jane Bowlby, one brother; Mick Powell, 14 grandchildren and 11 great grandchildren.

He was preceded in death by his parents, two brothers, and one son Jay Powell.

Funeral Services will be held at 6:00 PM, Friday, May 26, 2006, in the Purse Funeral Home, Adrian.

Visitation will be from 2:00 PM until the time of service in the Purse Funeral Home, Adrian. Military

Honors conducted by the Adrian VFW Post 1584 Annis Fint. Condolences may be offered to the family online at: www.pursefuneralhome.com

Arthur H. "Bud" Cubberly

Age 79, of Tecumseh, died June 11, 2006, at Veterans Administration Hospital, Ann Arbor.

He was born November 19, 1926 in Waldron, the son of Frederick and Belle (Randolph) Cubberly. On July 7, 1947 he married Betty Davies who preceded him in death on October 18, 2004.

Arthur was a graduate of Tecumseh High School. He was an active member of First Baptist Church, Tecumseh. He was retired from Tecumseh Products Company with 40 years of service. Bud was an avid woodworker who enjoyed making toys; and in his later years pocket crosses which he gave away to anyone he met.

Bud proudly served his country, joining the Navy in 1943. He received 5 Bronze Star Medals for his service in the Pacific.

Bud is survived by four children, David Cubberly, Kathy (Perl) Sebring, Paul Cubberly, and Sharon (David) Prill, all of Tecumseh; 7 grandchildren; and 9 great grandchildren.

In addition to his wife Betty, he was preceded in death by 2 grandughters, ChloÂŽ Marie Cubberly and Joann Marie Prill, and four brothers, and one sister.

Funeral services will be held 1:00 p.m. Thursday, June 15, 2006 at First Baptist Church, Tecumseh, with Rev. Clayton Carn & Rev. John Landis officiating. Interment will follow at Brookside Cemetery with military honors conducted by the Tecumseh American Legion #34 and the Tecumseh V.F.W #4187.

Visitation will be from 6-8 p.m. on Tuesday and from 2-4 & 6-8 p.m. on Wednesday at Purse Funeral Home, Tecumseh.

Memorial contributions may be made to First Baptist Church, Tecumseh. Condolences may be offered online @ pursefuneralhome.com

JUDY ANN ZAMMIT (nee GIEDRA)

Judy Ann (nee Giedra), beloved wife of John was born May 18, 1952 and passed away June 21, 2006 after a courageous, 11-year battle with ovarian cancer. She was employed at GM Fisher Body Fleetwood, became the first female electrical journeyman at the plant,

graduated from University of Michigan and was promoted to skilled trades supervisor. She enjoyed her retirement years living in Lake Erin in the Irish Hills. Her passions were reading, gardening, traveling, home repair and especially making friends with everyone she met.

In addition to her husband, John, Judy is survived by her devoted parents. Lillian Anderson and Alexander (Jeanette) Giedra, her brother Gary (Marie) Giedra, Allen and the late Kevin Giedra, her uncles Albert (Carol) Russell, George (Barbara) Russell, William (Audrey) Kima, her aunt

Jean Fitzgerald, her nieces Rachel (Brad) Huwe, nephew Aaron Geidra. Also surviving are her stepchildren Timari (Nick) Deane, John A. (Paula) Zammit II, Trina (Mickey) Cofer, Tricia (Marty) Segar, and Jospeh (Amanda) Zammit including 23 step grandchildren and 5 grandnieces and grand nephews. Visitation Saturday, June 24, 2:00 p.m.-8:00 p.m. at Purse Funeral Home, 210 Pottawatamie, Tecumseh, MI 49286 (517) 423-2121. Sunday, June 25, 7:00 p.m. evening vigil service at St. Elizabeth Church, 500 Union Street, Tecumseh. Monday 10:00 a.m. funeral Mass of the Resurrection with Rev. Fr. Daniel Wheeler presiding. Interment at Holy Sepulchre Cemetery, Southfield, MI. Memorial Contributions may be made to either: The Capuchin Soup Kitchen, 1820 Mt. Elliott St. Detroit, MI 48207 or Gilda's Club 3517 Rochester Road, Royal Oak, MI 48073 Condolences may be offered at: www.pursefuneralhome.com

Percy Dean Sweet

Age 74, of Adrian, passed away August 8, 2006. He was born July 14, 1932, in Tecumseh, MI, the son of Donald & Helen (Maltby) Sweet. On December 7, 1957, he married Ruby Cox, in Johnson City, TN. In December of this year, they would have celebrated their 49th anniversary. Percy worked for Stubnitz-Green from 1950 to 1982 and then he worked for the Adrian Dominican Sisters from 1983 to 1997.

In addition to his wife Ruby, he is survived by two sons; Richard D. (Barbara) Sweet of Adrian, Michael W. Sweet of Lambertville, one daughter; Cynthia Mary (Gregg) Fay of Adrian, four grandchildren; Matthew & Danielle Fay and Rachelle & Christian Sweet, one sister; Patsy (Pete) Bodella of Adrian, and several nieces, nephews, and cousins.

He was preceded in death by his parents, three brothers; Arthur Sweet, Lester Sweet, and Raynor Sweet, six sisters; Gladys Koradjian, Beatrice Hand, Leona Sanderson, Donna Woodard, Doris Sweet, and Gloria Sweet, and five nephews.

Funeral Services will be held 11:00 AM, Saturday, August 12, 2006, in the Purse Funeral Home, Adrian, with Rev. Doug Winters officiating. Interment will follow in Brookside Cemetery, Tecumseh, MI. Visitation will be on Friday from 2:00 PM to 8:00 PM in the Purse Funeral Home, Adrian. Condolences may be offered to the family online at: www.pursefuneralhome.com

MARGARET A. PETERSON

Age 66, of Tecumseh, formerly of Clinton, died March 27, 2005

She was born April 26, 1938 in Tecumseh, MI the daughter of Clarence and Kathryn (Dermyer) Champanois.

She was a devoted daughter, mother and grandmother. She was particularly passionate about her

grandchildren. Margaret was employed at Clinton Community Schools for over 28 years, where she enjoyed her job and loved her coworkers. Margaret loved to cook for her family and friends. She was a former member of the Raisin Valley Golf Club.

Margaret is survived by one daughter, Renee Claycomb, and her husband Greg of Avon Lake, OH, one son, Rick Peterson , and his wife Debbie of Saline, one grandson, Brian, twin granddaughters, Lauren and Jennifer; and two brothers, David (Linda) Champanois of New Port Richey, FL, and Clarence C. (Debbie) Champanois of Brooklyn.

She was preceded in death by her parents, Clarence and Kathryn, and her sister Beverly Lewis.

Funeral services will be held 11:00 a.m. Thursday March 31, 2005 at the First Baptist Church, Tecumseh with the Rev. John Landis officiating. Interment will follow in Brookside Cemetery. Visitation will be from 6-8 p.m. both Tuesday and Wednesday at Purse Funeral Home, Tecumseh.

Memorial contributions may be made to the American Diabetes Association.

Condolences may be offered to the family at: www.pursefuneralhome.com

Linda Altmann

Age 73, of Tecumseh, went to be with

the Lord on June 16, 2006, at the home of her daughter

in Risingsun, OH, following a long and lengthy

illness.

She was born July 21, 1932 in Pineville, KY, the

daughter of Starling and Rosa (Parker) Boatwright

On January 12, 1962 she married Charles J. Altmann,

Sr. He preceded her in death on June 3, 1994.

She is survived by 3 daughters, Rose (Warren) Bell of

Milan, Charlene Hawkins of Lansing, Connie (Harold)

Mitchem of Risingsun, OH; 5 sons, Roy Samuel (Denise)

Brantley of Columbia, TN, Roger Brantley of Tecumseh,

David (Margaret) Brantley of Sidney, OH, Chuck

(Jackie) Altmann of Tecumseh; 4 step children, Sharon

(James) Miracle of Morristown, TN, Ronald (Glenna)

Altmann of Henderson, NV, Lawrence Altmann of

Morristown, TN, Cheryl (John) Gerber of Tecumseh; 15

grandchildren; numerous great grandchildren; and 2

sisters, Gracie Miracle of Trenton, and Lucy Bailey of

Ewing, VA.

In addition to her husband Charles, Sr. she was

preceded in death her parents; her son, Starling

Brantley, one brother and 5 sisters.

Funeral services will be held 11:00 a.m. Tuesday, June

20, 2006 at Purse Funeral Home, Tecumseh.

Interment will follow at Brookside Cemetery, Tecumseh.

Visitation will be from 2-4 & 6-8 p.m. on Monday and

from 10:00 am until time of services Tuesday at

Purse Funeral Home, Tecumseh.

Memorial contributions may be made to the American

Lung Association.

Grace Louise Bartlett

Age 82, of Adrian, went to be with her precious Savior on June 20, 2006, at home with all seven of her children and families gathered around her.

Louise was born on November 19, 1923 in Louisa, Kentucky to Virginia Tully Pitman and Smith C. Pitman. She was the oldest child of six.

Louise won a Spelling Bee Contest in grade school and became an avid reader which she continued to be as long as her health would allow. During Louise's 13th year, her mother died in a house fire and Louise assumed responsibility as housekeeper and caregiver

for her siblings.

She met the love of her life, Edgar Earl Bartlett on August 13, 1939 in Spruce Pine, North Carolina, where he was born and raised. Ed's cousin set up their first date which was on "Decoration Day" at Bear Creek Cemetery, just out of Spruce Pine. They were married on December 21, 1940 in Elizabethton, Tennessee. They were blessed with eight children to which she stayed close all of her life. The family moved to Michigan in 1956, and most of them have remained in Michigan.

Louise became a young widow at 42, when Ed died suddenly of a heart attack in 1966, leaving Louise

with six children still at home to raise. Their youngest child was 13 months old at the time. Louise

became not only mother, but supporter, provider, and maintainer of house and home. She raised a large

garden every year, and fed her family largely from its produce.

In later years, Louise loved to travel and would take road trips to West Virginia, North Carolina, Tennessee, Kentucky, and Montana. She also flew to see children in California and Idaho, although her favorite destination was the Great Smoky Mountains in the fall.

She became a Foster Grandparent in 1986 and worked with handicapped children at Sutton School. She

especially enjoyed working with Mrs. Hissong, reading to the children and becoming a part of their lives.

Louise was a member of the Bible Missionary Church in Adrian, and loved her church family. Louise leaves

behind a great host of friends, as well as family.

Survivors include four daughters: Carolyn Bartlett and Janice Bartlett of Adrian, Dorothy (Wilford) Miller of

Detroit, Nancy (Mark) Sawmiller of Caldwell, Idaho, and one former daughter-in-law (Charles), Viola

Cousino of Petersburg; three sons: William (Barbara) Bartlett of Midland, Robert (Bonnie) Bartlett of

Adrian, and Mark (Susan) Bartlett of Anaconda, Montana. Also surviving are 2 brothers: Robert Pitman

and Marian (Smitty) Pitman, both of San Diego, California; and 14 grandchildren, and several close nieces and nephews.

She was preceded in death by her husband, Edgar Bartlett, her son Charles Bartlett, her parents, and four siblings: Ralph Pitman, who died in infancy, Jean Woods, William Pitman, and her beloved sister, Lucille Wright.

Louise will be greatly missed and is loved by all who knew her. Viewing will be Thursday, June 22 and Friday, June 23 from 2-4pm and 6-8pm at Purse Funeral Home, 2959 North Adrian Highway, Adrian.

Services will be at Purse Funeral Home with Pastor Eddie McClure of Adrian and Rev. Thomas Jackson of

North Carolina officiating on Saturday, June 24, 2006 at1:00pm. Louise will be laid to rest next to her husband at Packard Cemetery in Seneca, Michigan. Condolences may be offered to the family online at:

www.pursefuneralhome.com

Joseph Â“JoeÂ” G. Stevenson

Age 93, of Adrian, passed away, July 3, 2005, at Lenawee Medical Care Facility. He was born October 28, 1911 in Saunemin, IL, the son of Robert & Lettie (Worthington) Stevenson. On October 22, 1947, he married Irene Schmidt in Angola, Ind., she preceded him in death. When he was nine his family moved to Britton prior to moving to Adrian in 1926. He was a 1929 graduate of Adrian High School. Joe served in WW II in the US Army and received the Bronze Star. He was a member of the American Legion Post #97 for over 50 years, and the Adrian VFW Post 1584 Annis Fint, the 40 & 8 and a past Member of the Elks. Joe was an avid fisherman and enjoyed playing golf. He was retired from the Adrian Post Office after 30 years of service.

Joseph is survived by one daughter Lona (Carey) Pettit of Adrian, two grandsons, Jeremy (Cheryl) Ries of Tipton and Jon (Julie) Ries of Tipton, seven great grandchildren, Kyle, Rachael, Troy, Rebecca, Miranda, Eric, and Andrew Ries and one sister Glyda Shubel of Summerville, SC. and several nieces and nephews.

He was preceded in death by his parents, his wife Irene Agnes Stevenson in 1995, one sister and six brothers

Funeral Services will be held 11:00 AM Wednesday, July 6, 2005, in the Purse Funeral Home, Adrian, with Rev. Joel Sarrualt officiating. Interment will follow in St. John's Lutheran Cemetery, Adrian with Military Honors conducted by the Adrian VFW Post 1584 Annis Fint. Visitation will be from 2:00 PM to 4:00 PM & 6:00 PM to 8:00 PM on Tuesday in the Purse Funeral Home, Adrian. Condolences may be offered to the

family at: www.pursefuneralhome.com

JERRY KORICAN

DATELINE: BRITTON/TECUMSEH

Gerald "Jerry" Korican, age 56, of Britton & Tecumseh,

died October 30, 2006.

He was born September 1, 1950 in Tecumseh, MI, the son

of Thomas and Mary (Machacek) Korican.

On April 12, 1975, he married Barbara Branigin, she

survives.

Jerry was co-owner of Korican Farms, Britton.

He was a graduate of Britton-Macon High School, Class

of 1968, and attended Eastern Michigan University.

Jerry served as Macon Township Constable and was on

the board of Blissfield Sugarbeet Growers and

Greenstone Farm Credit Services Advisory Board.

He was a member of the Tecumseh Club, Tecumseh Country

Club, Crab Orchard Hunt Club, and the American

Bohemian Club

In addition to his wife Barb, he is survived by, his

daughter, Jennifer and son Greg, both at home; his

parents, Thomas and Mary Korican of Britton; sister

Marilyn (Michael) Jurasek of Bradenton, FL, Tom

(Elaine) Korican of Tecumseh, and Don (Colette)

Korican of Britton; double first cousin and faithful

golf partner,

John T. Korican of Manchester, and 5 nieces and a

nephew

Jerry was friend to all and will be greatly missed by

those whose paths he crossed.

Funeral services will be held 11:00 a.m. Friday

November 3, 2006 at the First Presbyterian Church of

Tecumseh with Rev. Richard Mortimer and Rev. Richard

Bruce officiating. Interment will follow at Ridgeway

Cemetery.

Visitation will be from 6-8 p.m. Wednesday and from

2-8 p.m. Thursday at J. Gilbert Purse Funeral Home,

2959 N. Adrian Hwy. (M-52) Adrian, MI.

Memorial contributions may be made to University of Michigan Bone Marrow Transplant Unit, Herrick Memorial

Hospital, First Presbyterian Church, Tecumseh

Condolences may be offered at: www.pursefuneralhome.com

Robert Earl Darm

DATELINE: HUDSON

Robert Earl Darm, 49, of Hudson, passed away December 4, 2006

at home after seventeen years of fighting cancer.

He was born April 9, 1957, the son Glenn & Ruth

(Ingram) Darm in Adrian, MI. On May 19, 1989, he

married Beverly Tackett, she survives. Robert worked

at KECY Products in Hudson. Robert served his country

in the U.S. Army.

In addition to his wife Beverly, he is survived by his

siblings, Virginia (Eugene) Withrow of Adrian, Melvin

(Diane) Darm of Blissfield, and Judy (Ted Betz)

Frederick of Jasper, brother in law; Trajan Espinoza

of Jackson and sister in law; Dorian Graybil of

Hudson, step father & mother in law; Robert (Donna)

Hawkins, several nieces & nephews, and great nieces &

great nephews.

He was preceded in death by his parents, Glenn & Ruth

Darm and sister, Karen Darm.

Funeral Services will be held 11:00 AM, Thursday,

December 7, 2006, in the J. Gilbert Purse Funeral

Home, Adrian, with Pastor / Elder Terry Alverson of

New Life Baptist Church officiating. Burial will

follow in Hunt Cemetery, Madison Twp., with Military

Honors conducted by the Adrian VFW Post 1584 Annis

Fint. Visitation will be on Wednesday from 2:00 PM to

4:00 PM & 6:00 PM to 8:00 PM in the J. Gilbert Purse

Funeral Home, Adrian, and also on Thursday from 10:00

AM until the time of service. In lieu of flowers,

memorial contributions can be made to Robert's family.

Condolences may be offered to the family online at:

www.pursefuneralhome.com

______________________________________________________________

Messages of Sympathy

__________________________________________________________________________________________

k8teacher@hotmail.com I'm sorry to hear about your loss. My thoughts and prayers are with you during this difficult time. MIKE BRINK

SLance@adriandominicans.org Bev, I am so sorry, I just realized that it was Bobby I read in the

paper. My deepest condolneces to you. I think of you and everyone quite often.

DATELINE: ONSTED

Edmund F. Lee "Eddie", age 59, of Onsted, passed away

Nov. 13, 2006.

He was born May 28, 1947, in Manistique, MI, the son

of Arnold and Geneve (Sorenson) Lee. On September 29,

1989 he married Kim D. Bauer.

He was a veteran of the United States Army, serving

during the VietNam War.

He was a member of Onsted American Legion Post #550.

Eddie was retired from Ford Motor Company, Saline.

He was an avid sports fan following, Ontsted High

School sports as well as the Detroit Tigers.

Eddie won a state championship in a left handed golf

tournament and was a member of the Irish Hills Pool

League.

In addition to his wife to his wife Kim, he is

survivied by 3 daughters, Tiffany (Rusty) Matheny of

Hamilton, OH, Meagan Lee at home, and Carmen (Mark)

Barden of Manchester; one son, Matt Williams at home;

5 grandchildren, Amanda, Michelle, Brandon, Faith, and

Blake; 6 brothers, Mike (Jean) of Kalamazoo, Pat

(Sandy) of Las Vegas, Tim (Ethel) of Green Springs, OH

, Barry Ned of Manchester, Kurt (Carolyn) of

Cheboygan, and Brian (Lori) Tecumseh, and numerous

nieces and nephews.

He was preceded in death by his parents.

Visitation will be held from 2-4 & 6-8 p.m. Thursday

at J. Gilbert Purse Funeral Home, Tecumseh.

Funeral services will be held 11:00 a.m. Friday

November 17, 2006 at

J. Gilbert Purse Funeral Home, Tecumseh, with Rev.

Daryl Onsted officiating. Military honors will

follow the service taking place at the funeral home

being conducted by Onsted American Legion Post #550.

A luncheon in honor of Eddie will also be held on

Friday following the funeral at: Onsted American

Legion, 333 Conner Street, Onsted, MI, 49286

Condolences may be offered at: www.pursefuneralhome.com

____________________________________________________________________________________________

lwithrow1@cfl.rr.com

Tiffany Lee
